definitions.definition: (usually academic) To review materials already learned in order to make sure one does not forget them, usually in preparation for an examination.
definitions.example: I need to study my biology notes.

definitions.definition: (academic) To take a course or courses on a subject.
definitions.example: I study medicine at the university.

definitions.definition: To acquire knowledge on a subject with the intention of applying it in practice.

definitions.example: He studied the map in preparation for the hike.

definitions.definition: To fix the mind closely upon a subject; to dwell upon anything in thought; to muse; to ponder.
To endeavor diligently; to be zealous.
Mental effort to acquire knowledge or learning.
definitions.example: The study of languages is fascinating.

definitions.definition: The act of studying or examining; examination.
definitions.example: I made a careful study of his sister.

definitions.definition: Any particular branch of learning that is studied; any object of attentive consideration.
A room in a house intended for reading and writing; traditionally the private room of the male head of household.
definitions.example: Father spends all his time in the study poring over manuscripts.

definitions.definition: An artwork made in order to practise or demonstrate a subject or technique.
definitions.example: a study of heads or of hands for a figure picture

definitions.definition: The human face, bearing an expression which the observer finds amusingly typical of a particular emotion or state of mind.
definitions.example: Geoffrey's face was a study in amazement [or in bewilderment, irritation, distress etc.]

definitions.definition: A piece for special practice; an étude.

definitions.example: That new study on noncommutative symmetries looks promising.

definitions.definition: One who commits a theatrical part to memory.
A state of mental perplexity or worried thought.
Thought, as directed to a specific purpose; one's concern.
definitions.example: My study was to avoid disturbing her.
